caption: Fantastic spot to eat something when in a hurry. Their service is fast, pricing is fair, awesome mood. I highly recommend this place
service was great, food was below par. Steak was dry although we ordered medium.  full course menu for $55 did not meet my expectation.

We came for Valentine’s Day. It was obvious that we weren’t the first priority. The manager seemed to direct staff to attend to VIP tables.  We both got the tasting menu, which included some standout dishes (pastas) and a free glass of Prosecco. We also bought a bottle of red wine. Unfortunately, it took two hours for our pasta to arrive. When the tenderloin steak came it was overcooked (probably by heat lamp). The halibut seemed bland, chewy, and under-seasoned. I’ve had some incredible meals in the past, but this was the kind of bill where you expect to be wowed. The food just wasn’t up to the standard.

My wife and I just discovered San Lorenzo and loved it!  The pastas are amazing.  The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating.  The inside is beautiful but it’s great for take out too.  The food travels well.  For nicer Italian food in DC it’s one of the best options in the city.  For the price it might be the best value you can find for high end homemade pasta.
Really adorable restaurant with a very creative menu and attentive, knowledgeable staff. Definitely recommend!
Somehow every time I come here, the food and experience gets better and better. Easily best Italian in D.C
Delicious food and gracious service in a stylish space. Try the squash blossoms and any of the pastas!
Legit Italian food. A real neighborhood gem with fantastic homemade pasta. Perhaps my favorite Italian place in the DMV area.
The service and the halibut were exquisite
Amazing execution of dishes. Service is always on point
The best Italian spot in DC hands down. Everything is incredible from the prosciutto and melon to the amazing pasta

Such a lovely dinner! Stumbled on this spot with friends, and so glad we did! Cozy vibe, food delicious, drinks superb, service wonderful. Pasta and cheesecake were particular highlights. Highly recommend!
The food was great, excellent wine list, extremely intimidate setting, fabulous.
Very tasty food and excellent service

San Lorenzo's menu is a delight and a comfort, with a relaxed environment and very kind staff to boot. The Chitarra is a lovely dish, extremely satisfying with a generous portion of lobster and clam and a very rich sauce. The crostini made the perfect complementary side, refreshing, smooth and delightfully peppery.
Good

Great vibe, good little bar, and excellent Italian food (and bread)!  The serving sizes are moderate - not tiny, but definitely not large by any means.  The Pappardelle rabbit ragu was great. Great wine selection!

An Italian friend of mine recommended this restaurant a long time ago and finally I get a chance to go the other night. I’m from Florence and usually I don’t go to Italian places because they tend to be overpriced and quality ok. I was eager to go this time because my friend told me food was good and at a reasonable price. The ambience is nice but as we entered the host brought us to a table where there was no chair for me. She let us take a seat at another table and we ordered. We got Pancetta di Maiale and polenta (very unusual, you don’t find it somewhere else), misticanza nice and fresh, bread to accompany dishes is delicious. Then, we got wine (the list is overpriced, btw!). So, our table was crowded and I asked if we could unite another table to ours so to have more space, since nobody were sitting next to us and the restaurant wasn’t full. One of the server (not the one we were assigned) said the other table was reserved and couldn’t accept our request. Which is fine, I understand. But then he started removing bread plates, other things and arranging the table to make more space as he wished. I didn’t like that, and asked him to leave everything like it was and that we would have survived without an extra table, arranging the extra thing on the love seat where I was seated. Then, a guy who brought us our meal, saw the scene, spoke to the host and he was able to give us another table. We appreciate that. All this under the eyes of the young owner, who didn’t even say hello or come to the table to greet us even though he noticed we were Italians. After the appetizers, we had pappardelle  with rabbit sauce (wonderful) and as a dessert Pumpkin pie. We expected something traditional but actually it was a delicious surprise, I recommend it. So food is really good here (authentic though, that I don’t know) and I would rate it high, our waiter was very nice and attentive, but the others not very much. As an Italian restaurant I would expect the owner to be nicer and warmer, and the whole staff to be very attentive and friendlier.  Also, during the dinner, the young owner was seated at the bar and burped very loudly. I’m sorry but this is unacceptable for me. Not very respectful of your guests.

Food was good but wines marked up!  When you know a bottle cost $37.00 and the menu has it $22 a glass, bottle at $110, you comment to the server about the price and get totally dismissed....not good.
Fantastic food-and even better service. They took great care of us on our anniversary!
The zucchini blossoms were nothing special and I found them somewhat greasy. The branzino was spectacular.  The blueberry cake with gelato was amazing.

My wife, daughter, and I ate at San Lorenzo, in Washgton, D. C., on Saturday night.  The restaurant is small and cozy.  The menu is diverse, and the server, Anne Marie, was knowledgeable and solicitous.  My daughter enjoyed the leg of duck, I had the tasty Fettucini di Vitello, and my wife had the veal chop.  Although the first two dishes were well worth it, when the veal chop was served, supposedly cooked to medium, I thought the calf would sit up and moo at us.  My wife asked for it to be cooked more.  When the dish came out a second time, it was little more than gristle and fat; my wife couldn't even cut it with the sharp knife they gave her for that purpose.  Again they took the veal away, this time bringing her Fettucine di Vitello (her second choice), in such haste it makes one wonder what took the original orders so long to appear.   To the credit of the management, they did not charge us for either the veal or the second dish of  Fettucini.  The wait for our food was much too long.  It seems to me that even on Saturday, which is the busiest night for dining, a good restaurant should be at its best, not at its slowest.  We would return to San Lorenzo, but it would be during the week, and we definitely wouldn't order the veal chop.

One of the best meals I’ve ever had. Ordered the chef’s 4 course tasting menu. The chef came out to check on dietary restrictions/preferences and we had our eye on the ravioli, so he made sure to include that and it literally (yes literally) brought a tear of joy to my eye. I almost didn’t trust him when he shaved an almost shocking pile of black truffle over them, but clearly he knew what he was doing. The staff was incredibly friendly and give a relaxed neighborhood vibe to what I was anticipating would be a stuffy restaurant. Cannot wait to go back.

Amazing pasta! I chose this place because in addition to great pasta dishes, they also offer two different types of gluten free pastas. I also enjoyed the cocktails and antipasta selections. Although, I wish they had gluten-free bread or rice crackers for the antipasta.
Cozy, great menu.
Service was a bit slow but the food is delicious and simple. Their sea bass and spinach  is mouth watering
The perfect restaurant excellent food great service nice cozy romantic atmosphere reasonably priced.
Great food and great service
Great little Italian restaurant in Shaw. Delicious pasta, great cocktails!
Great cocktails and food (outstanding pasta dishes).
Beautiful food in a beautiful room
Terrific food and staff! Awesome wine list. One of my fav dc restaurants
Amazing! The ravioli is out of this world and the cheesecake for dessert is a must eat

I've walked by here quite a bit on my way to All-Purpose Pizza, but I'm glad I finally went here instead. They provide variations of traditional Italian food prepared well, and it's very tasty. They offer bar seating for dinner, and I found that you get really good service at the bar. I don't know how often I'll get back here, as it's a decent walk to Shaw, but it's definitely on my list of places to visit again.
(Translated by Google) I love him 😍  (Original) Lo amo 😍

Everything was divine. The burrata was presented with roasted peppers which was a refreshing difference from most places. The squash blossoms were so good we ordered a second set. The fresh pastas were so delicious. The pork ribs were shareable and really tasty. The service was excellent.
Ok food but small portions for the price. Wait staff just elbowed there way in to take or place items. A disappointment.

Veal Cheeks-fabulous, bread-fabulous, polenta-perfection, rabbit rage-amazing, can they do anything wrong?  I doubt it!  This is just a great dining experience, the food is carefully thought out and delicious!  The dining rooms are charming (except for he tv) and the wait staff and hosts are fantastic.  Love going here, I is a real treat!  Don't miss it for great Italian in the City!
Wonderful environment and wonderful service.
Tuscan Italian Fare done right! Fantastic pastas , meats and seafood.
Great italian food, cozy little place
Very delicious if a bit fancy Italian food
Great Tuscan food. The ribs were delish. Wonderful and affordable wines
Yum
Awesome seafood and nice wine selection

The halibut was off the charts good! Amazing little spot near the convention center, bartender was good on the pours. And if you don't try the chocolate custard I don't know what's wrong with you. Had an awesome 3 course meal every bite was insanely good.
Bartender was awesome. Unfortunately reservation wasn't really honored (came to get us from bar 45 minutes after reservation). Food was simply prepared and very tasty. Wish service was up to par.

Great cooking, but waited 30 min to be seated when I had a 9:45  reservation. Ended up sitting at the bar. Ordered the rabbit Ragu papperdele, would recommend. About half the size of typical restaurant pasta portion, which is appropriate. Finished my plate. Bread and oil comes out to start. We did get free fried goat cheese which was delicious.
This restaurant is amazing, highly recommended. Superb Italian food.

I was very well impressed by the quality of their food, every dish was very well cooked and seasoned to perfection. Chef Andy was very kind to come and greet us, and I should say he is a very young talented Chef, my friends have lived in Italy for several years and  they were very pleased. The Branzino was amazing! I cud not say less for all the other dishes, we were not going to have dessert, but they send us a complimentary dessert and we had to order another one, my compliments to the Pastry Chef! Atmosphere was nice, charming place! Service was impeccable!
(Translated by Google) Delicious pasta  (Original) Pasta delicioso
Ravioli was good. Fish was not good. Food portion is so small based on what you pay!
Worth the hype. Small, charming space. Delicious food and drinks, menu is the perfect size/mix. Good service. I'll be back!
Food is good, and prices are fair, but the quantities... Way too few food, me and the table ate in like 3 minutes, and no one was satisfied. Not worth the money, and you leave hungry.
There were 3 of us so we were able to try one of each Christmas Eve selection on The Feast of Seven Fishes menu. The servings were the perfect size, aesthetically pleasing and flavorful.
Good food, a little loud.

Loved every minute! The server was attentive without being intrusive. She provided great recommendations. The brussel sprouts were divine. You have to try them. The servings were generous and left enough room for my girls and I to share dessert. I'll be back and next time I'm ordering something with prosciutto! They slice it right at the bar.
Excellent service from the moment I walked in the door as well as some very fine Tuscan cuisine.
Very good food and great service.  A little crowded and it gets cold if you sit near the door.  The waiter was excellent.  The food was very good- more traditional Italian.

It was a disappointing experience. It was not that the food was bad, because it wasn't.  The portion of the pasta was tiny.  I have seen half portions that we're larger.  Not that in itself is a bad thing the problem is not meeting expectations.  The waiter or the menu should have been clearer.  That segues me to the other problem.  The wait staff were on top of us for the whole meal, it just made us feel rushed and uncomfortable the whole meal. Partly this was the table we were seated at but it could certainly have been handled better.

I met a group of friends here on September 30th and the food was magnificent. Unfortunately, due to my late arrival I missed the appetizers but my friends said they were delicious. I ordered the braised ribs and I had cheesecake for dessert. The cheesecake was delicious and tasted perfectly. It was freshly made and had just enough cream cheese taste. Furthermore, I ordered a glass of moscato and it was sooo good that I wanted a second glass. Finally, the atmosphere is small and intimate. The service was really good. The food came pretty quickly.
Authentic Italian cuisine.
Nice environment and food is good

Food phenomenal, female bartender not so much.  Rushed and focused on her evening.  Bought a glass for a friend down the way and did not provide a full pour, just sloppy and not the caliber of dining establishment, needs to work at Whiskey Charlie’s.

The food was absolutely delicious and the cocktails we're equally as enjoyable. I tried the Negroni for the first time. The bar tender was very knowledgeable and friendly. The portion sizes are small but I guess that is what you can expect from this quality of food. I can't wait to try other items in the menu!

Off to a good start! Massimo Fabbri's new restaurant is kicking off well from what I could tell.  First, the service was extraordinary and Joko (sp?), our Croatian server, was the epitome of good service in every way. He was hand-selected by Massimo to come work here upon its opening, so enough said.  The food was also delicious and the six of us had a smattering of nearly everything on the menu. My halibut was immaculate, all the pastas were perfect, and I would say that if we had any complaints at all, it would be about the veal Milanese, which was served dry and, although still quite good, would've benefited from at least a lemon or some kind of sauce (after Milanese is not synonymous with Austrian schnitzel, which this more resembled). I would say this was only a minor issue, though, as the veal itself was prepared very well. After all, it is also still a brand new restaurant and it will take some time for the kinks to be worked out.  Further praise includes the prices, which were very reasonable for a DC restaurant, and, since you are able to order half-portions of the pasta, you can have a very good meal for a good price or an even better, diverse meal for an average price!  In summary, this restaurant is an excellent choice for a classy Italian meal at a much more affordable level than some of the other, pretentious restaurants that inhabit the city - I would highly recommend a visit here.
Perfect.  From the service to the tomatoes served with the burrata, the dressing on the arugula salad and bite of the pasta, everything was perfect.  Order the ribs.
Amazing food, dessert and people!
What a well priced enjoyable meal. Pasta made fresh, risotto was perfect. Very good service. Great for a enjoyable dinning experience with a friend or date. Good size but reservations go quickly.
Great food and great service.
Incredible food and great atmosphere. We ordered the calamari, ribs, truffle mushroom tortellini, and the seafood risotto and all were delicious. Servers were very knowledgeable.

I want to give this place five stars. I really do. But they have a few kinks to iron out.  Our dinner reservation was at 21:00 on Friday. We usually like to arrive early at restaurants to enjoy some cocktails at the bar before we sit down for dinner. The hostesses were friendly, but also looked uncomfortable when they realized we arrived early. We said we were fine waiting at the bar until our actual rezzie.  It turned out they were running behind. Way behind. We did not get seated until 30 minutes past our reservation! Yup. 30 minutes. I should’ve known from the facial expressions of the woman who I assume is management level. She looked very stressed. The thing about being in the hospitality business is the ability to keep your cool even when the situation is intense.  We went ahead and ordered a bottle of the 2014 Masi Brolo di Campofiorin along with the roasted calamari at the bar since we started feeling hunger pangs. When our table was finally ready, the hostess hovered behind us and kept reminding us that our table was ready. I finally turned around and asked her to give us a few minutes to finish our antipasto. Given how long they had us wait for our table, I didn’t think it was too much to ask her to wait a couple of minutes. Sigh.  The food made up for it, tho. The dishes were amazing. The ingredients were fresh and delicious. We loved the roasted calamari, chitarra, and risotto. I had to return my mahi-mahi because it was heavily salted. They got it right the next time around. The fish was fresh and the kale and spinach that accompanied it was delicious.  Lastly, our sever was great. She was friendly and attentive.  I will definitely be back, but will give them time to smooth things out.
Nice atmosphere and truly Italian cooking; I reccomend this place.

Small place with a neighborhood feel, but with legit honest Italian food. True to Italian culinary form, ingredients and tradition drive the menu, rather than a trendy list of ingredients. I tried two fresh pastas that were perfect and left me hoping to return and sample through the rest of the menu. Plenty of approachable Italian wines and a contemporary cocktail program. I'll be back. Bravo, Chef Massimo!
Excellent food with great atmosphere Great service. One of my favorite Italian restaurant in DC.
